fields.description: Ideally the Bug life cycle ends at a stage called 'Closed'. But here, We only have 'Resolved', it makes it hard for the tester to identify which ones are closed and which ones to be verified by him. It will be good if we a status called 'Closed'

fields.description: When I try to add a list of email addresses with more than 13 addresses to the Email or Email Diff service for commit notifications, the web page hangs with the Save button reading "Saving...".  A list with 12 addresses works.
fields.summary: Cannot add more than 13 email addresses to the Email service for commit notifications (BB-5160)

fields.description: I am accustomed from previous setups to watching the stream of commit email subject lines for things I might want to examine more closely. The grouping of changesets that are pushed together into one email with only the number of changesets in the subject line forces me to open each such email and scan it for commit messages to find out what might be interesting. I would very much like to still be able to receive one email per changeset even if they are pushed all at once.
fields.summary: Create an option in the email service to send one email per changeset

fields.description: Having to scroll is a terrible idea from usability point of view. You could implement the filtering without adding any scrollbars with overflow CSS property.
fields.summary: new repository chooser on the right is terrible

fields.description:
I created a fork of another repo, and I'm finding it quite troublesome to keep in sync with the original repo. If I'm not missing something, I have to perform the following steps to pull in changes:

# Pull from parent Bitbucket repo to my local repo and merge
# Push from my local repo to my Bitbucket repo

I have to do this every time I want to sync up the two repos after the parent repo makes a change! Could you add a web-based interface to pull directly from the parent Bitbucket repo to my Bitbucket repo, bypassing my local repo entirely? Or at least an API so I can run commands against my Bitbucket repo to do the same thing?

Thanks! :)
fields.summary: merge changes from parent repo into a fork on the server (BB-5158)

fields.description:
Currently when writing a comment the escape key cancels the entry. I can definitely see the logic for this, but as a ViM user I have accidentally cancelled so many long and time-consuming comments through natural muscle memory reflex, leading to quite a bit of shouting. I'm certain there are other ViM users out there that have suffered the same fate.

Would removing the escape key -> cancel comment mapping be something you'd consider?  Please don't let any prejudice against ViM cloud your judgement.

Many thanks,

Nik
fields.summary: Escape key cancelling comment

fields.description:
The download link to get a repo as a zip file is boken on custom domains.

For example, this link used to work and now produces a 404: http://hg.berniecode.com/animator/get/tip.zip

The download page for that repo - http://hg.berniecode.com/animator/downloads - still advertises the broken URL.

The non-custom domain link works fine: https://bitbucket.org/berniecode/animator/get/tip.zip

I've marked this critical because it has basically disabled every software download link I've ever distributed.
fields.summary: Zip download links broken on custom domains

fields.summary: Can't change the image size in wiki!

fields.description:
It would be nice to be able to have a download "releases" type section.  This section could be a list of attached files that are derived from tags from the project.

For now I can use the wiki and upload a copy of compiled release zips, but it would be nice to have that handled on the bitbucket.org side.
fields.summary: Releases page

fields.description:
It would be really sweet to have the ability to add generic field types as extra fields to a repository.

For example adding a client field, or a "for x content management system" to a repository, without the need bloat the name of the project.

I would like to see the following field types as attachable fields to a repo:

* *Text Field* - a simple text field
* *Select List* - configurable similar to the way the issue tracker select lists are setup
* ** TextArea - a text area field that could have a configurable number of rows

It would also be nice to be able to get at this information using the REST API as well.
fields.summary: Addition of dynamic field meta data against a repository (BB-5157)

fields.description:
I just recently started to use your service (aside: I'm in love) and attempted to add some bitbucket cli functionality into my dev environment by utilizing the REST API. Below are several different ideas that may make programming against the API even easier while also moving it towards a more pure RESTful interface.

==== Uniform Interface ====\\
Currently Deployment Keys, Likes, Repository Links, according to the documentation (https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Using+the+bitbucket+REST+APIs), are all using what I assume is an older uri (i.e. https://bitbucket.org/!api/1.0/repositories/bitbucket/_) whereas all other resources are accessible via the more comprehensible https://api.bitbucket.org/1.0/_. I chalked this difference up to the API's experimental nature but felt it deserved a mention. I think it is implicit how a uniform entry to the API lends it self to ease/quality of programmability.

==== No Client State Tracking Yields Robustness ====\\
Terrible title I know but regardless, much of the inspiration for this was taken from salesforce.com's implementation of REST (http://www.salesforce.com/us/developer/docs/api_rest/).

I shouldn't have to code into the client the various uris that the API provides to me. This would break my application on every API change. Not only that, but I have no way on the client side of probing the interface for exposed resources. For example:

bq. curl https://api.bitbucket.org/1.0\\
{\\
"changesets":"/[uri]",\\
"deployment_keys":"/[uri]"\\
...\\
}\\
This way I can build the client around what is actually there not what the documentation said when I first started development. It's easy to see how the client can react gracefully to api changes if the keys ('changeset' and 'deployment_keys' in the above example) remain constant throughout a version.


I believe what's being done currenty with the repositories resource is exemplary and should be the model for all other resources.
fields.summary: REST API Making the Bitbucket RES API more RESTful (BB-50)

Currently of the repos I have made, the /repo/mine page says I have made 42, 0, 0, 0, and 0 commits whereas in reality I have made 33, 12, 1, 1, and 10 respectively.
fields.summary: Commit count incorrect on /repo/mine page

fields.description:
I would like there to be an option for users to elect to receive email notifications of commits to repositories they are following.  I am aware of the following methods for receiving this information, but they all have shortcomings:

# Subscription to RSS feeds.  My colleagues are used to email, and know how to filter it etc.  Also, it is good to have commit messages in a central location, and the email client is the location of choice for many people.  The Mac OS Mail RSS client is not very reliable, for example.
# Setting up a service to post to one or more email addresses.  The list of addresses either has to be maintained by the administrator, which causes additional work, or users have to join some external email list (e.g. a Google group), which also needs to be set up separately.

I would like a solution which can be managed by the end-user.  It seems like an option to receive email notifications for commits to all (or some) followed repositories would be the best.  This would be similar to how issue notifications work.
fields.summary: Receive email notifications of commits to followed repositories

fields.description: It would be great being able to subscribe to changes in the issuetracker via RSS!
fields.summary: RSS for issuetracker

fields.description: It would be great to be able to subscribe to changes in the Wiki via RSS.
fields.summary: RSS for changes in wiki

fields.description:
Some things I noticed about the POST service that I considere bugs:

* Actual POST data is in the format\\
{{{\\
#!python\\
payload=%7B%22repository%22%3A+%7B%22website%22%3A+%22%22%2C+%22fork%22%3A+false...\\
}}}\\
what has two issues:\\
a) the client has to strip off the "payload=" part of the message\\
b) the actual content is URL encoded what makes no sense for POST data
* The triggered message from the POST service will be sent twice to the client (one duplicate after around 20 seconds), see screenshots!

I hope you can resolve this issues because I have build a small update server for my live system that relies on the POST service. :)

Kind regards
fields.summary: Strange behaviour of the POST service (BB-8245)

fields.description:
Right now only the last 5 (or so) commits are shown in the overview tab of the project. It would be useful to see last actions on the project in the same tab (probably underneath the commits).\\
Actions like - bugtracking activity and wiki activity for project that use bug tracking and/or wiki.

Maybe if you think that this is not an appropriate place, add another tab – say "Summary" or "Activity" or whatever name you think suits best.

Having such a summary information of recent activity helps "get into latest happenings" in the project very quickly at a glance. This is especially important in the projects that have more collaborators.

Thanks for considering,\\
Max.
fields.summary: Overview of last activity in the project in the "Overview" tab (BB-4666)

fields.description:
The current default commit message for pull requests just references the pull request id/ and contains no information about what has been pulled.

The pull request title usually contains information about what is being pulled in, if the default merge message used the pull request title and still referenced the pull request id it would be very useful. We are either currently copying the title in manually when accepting a pull request or developers have to look up a pull request using the id in the git log message.

This suggestion becomes powerful when combined with the JIRA DVCS connector and the upcoming smart commits feature. The pull requester places the JIRA key (Something we are already doing) into the pull request title along with the smart commit e.g. #closes . When the pull request is accepted and the pull request title is placed in the merge message, the DVCS connector will link the JIRA issue and transition it according to the smart commit.
fields.summary: The default pull request merge message should be the title of the pull request + the pull request id (BB-5142)

h2. Error page content :
Oops! An error occurred.

We've been notified and we'll look into the problem.

Guru meditation: d2e7b20541504b01aa205de24ea68788$0766baf418c3fab481131ec2cae93649

h2. Sample README.md to reproduce the crash follows :
####################################################

h1. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit
####################################################

(Nullam ac consectetur nulla. Integer rhoncus metus id elit auctor elementum)

h2. Curabitur ac purus leo :
condimentum/invariusquis (Etiam enim arcu)             malesuada n'ec malesuada aliquet, aliquet commodo elit (ellentesque habitant morbi tristique)\\
condimentum/hendrerit/vel (Etiam enim arcu)              sénectus et netus et malesuada .fames ac turpis egestas

h2. Curabitur libero libero :
# Curabitur pharetra venenatis tor/tor\\
Amet: quis ./tristi.que -diam pulvinar -ut python > ./Quis-que.t\\
=> Aenean auctor mauris vel est, iacéuliés blandit\\
=> Nam fermentum ligula et augue malesuada in volutpat lacus scelerisque
# Aenean arcu nulla, dignissim et b'ibendum vel, fermentum: a urna.\\
=> Sed laoreet, mauris et accumsan mollis\\
Amet: quis ./tristi.que -diam pulvinar -ut python > ./Quis-que.t
fields.summary: Bad markdown in README.md make the overview page crash

fields.description: users MUST be able to sort by date closed/resolved! How else are we to make release notes listing bugs fixed since last release? (don't make me dig through source code control to make release notes, please!).
fields.summary: MUST be able to sort by date closed/resolved! How to make release notes?

fields.description: When notifying users, provide an option to allow the user to choose which types of notifications should be directed to which address. For example, all notifications about a team should only go to a users "work" email while personal repository notifications should go to a "personal" designated email.
fields.summary: User based notifications (BB-5119)

fields.description: I would like for their to be a filed to enter a nick to view my profile through so I can see which repository's they can view and what they can do from their.
fields.summary: User based visibility test

fields.description:
A moment ago, it looked as though one of my organization's groups (thirteen23:developers) was shadowed on my personal account (adamesque:developers), pushing me over my personal plan contributors limit (our organization just added a 6th contributor).

Under "Access via groups", I saw these six people linked in via this adamesque:developers group, but in the Groups section of my account page, this group was not listed.

Turns out, I'd granted the thirteen23:developers group access to one of my private personal repos, and needed to revoke access there, but this information wasn't available on the Plans & Billing page, and caused a lot of confusion until I realized what was going on.

It'd be nice if the "Access via groups" section could also say which repository access was granted through.

Thanks,\\
Adam
fields.summary: More information needed on Account > Plans & Billing page (BB-5108)

fields.description: Please support git tags in your website - so that tags can be viewed and manipulated
fields.summary: Support git tags in your website
Create an issue from a commit message (BB-5107)

fields.description: Dashboard shows notifications on new comments in changesets, but clicking that link does not show the comment. It will show corrent changeset but without any comments. Comments can be seen when clicking link from notification in inbox.
fields.summary: Changeset comments not visible anymore (BB-5113)

fields.description: When I try to invite a user via email address to share a repository, I always get the 'This repository no longer exists.' message.  It doesn't matter what repo I try to share.
fields.summary: Trying to invite a user always shows the 'This repository no longer exists.' message

fields.description:
On organization pages with custom domains, the Repository links on the sidebar seem to use the custom domain, but the 'Repositories' link next to Dashboard does not seem to use the custom domain.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Custom Domains for Repositories (BB-5106)

fields.description:
Having a nice shortcut option to directly open a repo from the dashboard would be super handy.

something simple like cmd/ctrl clicking on the repo link. (pressing cmd/ctrl could change the text of the link?)
fields.summary: cmd / ctrl clicking on a repo link should open in git(sourcetree/tower/etc) (BB-5105)

fields.description: Cannot add new page to wiki in web interface
fields.summary: Cannot add new page to wiki in web interface

fields.description:
Currently for issues (when it comes to dates) you can only sort by the date the issues was created.  It would be nice to be able to sort on the date an issues was commented on/modified.

Rationale: Going over issues with the team we can sort by date to cover issues that were newly submitted since our last meeting.  It would then be nice to sort on modifications date to go over any comments people had made to previously discussed issues.

Is there a way to do this currently?
fields.summary: Sort Issues by Date modified (BB-5104)

fields.description:
Every time an or clause is added to the filter, another "unset" option is added to the select. e.g. on the third component or clause, there are three "unset" options to choose from

see attachment
fields.summary: Multiple "unset" options for component when building query

fields.description:
tl;dr: The 404 is pretty. Make a better 403.

----
It's pretty easy to generate the attached Django 403 error.

I regularly do it by accident using Chrome.

If I have bitbucket open, say:\\
https://bitbucket.org/elequ/elena/overview

If I then restart my browser session and the tab is automatically reopened to:\\
https://bitbucket.org/account/signin/?next=/elequ/elena/overview

This causes the csrf token failure. Makes sense, no problem. This is good and right.

The issue is this page looks so out of sorts on such an otherwise awesome project and reveals corporate knowledge. I didn't truly realise this project was Django, but now I do. Also it's so easy to make error pages in the Django.

Just heads up. Thanks!
fields.summary: Django "yellow screen of death" 403 (BB-5099)

fields.description: I am using Safari v6.0 (7536.25), Mac OS 10.7.4, and when I click on the "See more" link next to "Recent commits" I get a frozen page.  I can't scroll or click or do anything useful.  I don't recall having this problem with Safari v5, but I'm sort of new to Bitbucket and can't recall exactly.  I am submitting this bug from Chrome.
fields.summary: Safari 6 Problem

fields.description: It would be incredibly nice to have the ability to list your inbox messages as well as compose a message.
fields.summary: REST API: Add inbox

fields.description: The new dashboard just isn't as useful/productive as the old :(. I use to be able to see all my projects on the right hand side with icons indicating private or public. Now I just see the first 10 and there is no information. Please return to the previous view or provide an option to customize.
fields.summary: Dashboard

fields.description:
sometimes we want to be able to comment on a wiki page (like when it's a specification) so we can see that everyone has approved it or if someone wants to ask a question about it.

facilitate moving discussion about the contents to the web and out of email basically.

thanks!
fields.summary: Add comments thread support to wiki pages (like for tickets) (BB-5101)

fields.description:
steps to reproduce:

h1. select the "Open" button to get the default list (unordered which I just reported as an enhancement request, possibly BCLOUD-4314)
h1. click on the priority column header (which is more difficult to click than it should be - "!" is too narrow).
You get a sort of:

bq. sort: "priority" status: "new" or "open"


however 99% of the time users will want the highest priority at the top which would mean:

bq. sort: "-priority"


is what they really want and thus they have to click again to get what the want.  Save them a click and make them your friend  :-)
fields.summary: Initial priority order is "priority" when "-priority" is what users will want 99% of the time

fields.description: might as well give it *some* kind of order.  At least there's a *chance* you'll pick the one the use wanted (priority highest to lowest comes to mind, or milestone).
fields.summary: default display for "Open" is in seemingly random order (?) (BB-5103)

fields.description:
I create new private repository and see other developers commits\\
screenshot http://img19.imageshack.us/img19/2838/bitbucketoo.png
fields.summary: Strange commits

fields.description:
e.g., sort = "-responsible -priority"   to sort by person and then sort by priority within each person's issues (this is _by far_ the most desired view here).

Thanks!
fields.summary: FR: Need access to sort in advanced query page.  Include compound sort

fields.description:
Yesterday I found that my SSH public key was suddenly rejected.  I had not changed it myself.  Upon logging in and looking at my public key in my account, I found that the text " None" occurred after the end of it.  Other than that it still matched my actual public key as far as I could tell.

Removing this text and saving did not fix the rejection, but deleting the key entirely and entering it again (the same key) did fix it.  I can perform git operations as before, and I did not have to create a new keypair to restore functionality.

This may happen to other users so I thought I would report it.  I did find two other similar user reports through Google searching.
fields.summary: SSH key corrupted, re-uploading resolves

fields.description:
Previous workflow:

h1. Check "resolved".
h1. Select new person (e.g. boss) in assign box.
h1. Save
New workflow

h1. Click "Resolve"
h1. Wait for page to load
h1. Select "Edit"
h1. Wait for page to load.
h1. Select new person in assign box.
h1. Save
Also it means that there are two updates to the ticket.
fields.summary: Cannot assign issue and resolve in one action anymore.

fields.description:
Considering that:

* we have plenty of repositories.
* that the list of repositories is now relatively tiny.

the new design is a regression as it does not allow us to see as many repositories as before.
fields.summary: The new Dashboard page design is worse than the previous one
